intro: Ceratopetalum tetrapterum, commonly known as the four-winged rock-heath, is a shrub native to the arid regions of western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers that bloom in spring, attracting nectar-feeding insects. Its adaptations to dry environments include deep root systems and reduced leaf surface area. Ceratopetalum tetrapterum is often found in rocky outcrops and sandy soils, showcasing its resilience in harsh climates.
